title: Gulmarg Srinagar Pahalgam
desc: The land of sparkling rivers and pristine lakes, of startling gardens and regal Chinar trees, Kashmir boasts of some of the most beautiful flowering meadows and snow-capped peaks.

description: • Arrival in Srinagar & Shikara Ride
• Meet our representative at Srinagar airport, transfer to hotel/Houseboat.
• In the evening, shikara ride in world-famous Dal lake.
• Overnight stay at Srinagar.
• Srinagar to Gulmarg
• After breakfast, transfer to Gulmarg via Tangmarg.
• Enroute visit Apple Orchards, Cherry Orchards, and Strawberry fields.
• In Gulmarg visit Khilanmarg and take a ride in the world's highest cable car 'Gondola' or enjoy your day playing golf in the world's highest golf course.
• Overnight stay at Gulmarg.
• Gulmarg to Pahalgam
• After breakfast, transfer to Pahalgam.
• Enroute visit Awantipora Ruins, Saffron Fields.
• In Pahalgam, visit Aru valley, Betaab valley (on your own cost).
• Overnight stay at Pahalgam.
• Pahalgam to Srinagar & Mughal Garden
• After breakfast, transfer to Srinagar, check-in to hotel.
• Afternoon, leave for local sightseeing of Srinagar City.
• Visit Mughal gardens: Chesma Shahi (Mughal Spring), Nishat (The Garden of Bliss), Shalimar (The Abode of Love).
• Overnight stay at Srinagar.
• Srinagar - Sonmarg - Srinagar
• After breakfast, transfer to Sonmarg for a day trip.
• Enroute see Hazratbal Shrine, Gagangir Tourist Village.
• The drive from Srinagar to Sonmarg is beautiful, passing through towns and villages, with scenic views of paddy fields and rivers.
• In Sonmarg, you can visit Thajwas Glacier (4 kms from Sonmarg, local taxi needed).
• Return to Srinagar in the evening.
• Overnight stay at Srinagar.
• Departure
• After breakfast, check out from hotel and drive to Srinagar Airport.

• Visit Apple Orchards, Cherry Orchards, Strawberry fields

title: Manali Kasol Amritsar
desc: these three destinations offer a diverse range of experiences, from the natural beauty of Manali and Kasol to the cultural and religious significance of Amritsar.

description: • Meet the Travelworld representative at the railway station in the morning.
• Contact details, timing, and pickup point will be sent via WhatsApp a day before departure.
• Enjoy a comfortable journey through picturesque landscapes as you head towards Jalandhar, the gateway to the adventure.
• After reaching Punjab, you will be asked to put your luggage into a tempo traveller, with all large bags tied on top.
• Separate out warm clothes and a pair of clothes for Amritsar in a small backpack.
• Attend the Wagah Border Indo-Pak historic ceremonial parade.
• Visit the Golden Temple and explore Amritsar market.
• Please note: Wagah Border visit is only included if you travel by 19411-SBIB DLPC EXP or Janmabhoomi Express-19107. If the train is delayed, you may miss the Wagah Border.
• Night drive to Manali.
• Arrive in Kasol early in the morning and check-in.
• Rest, have a hot breakfast, and freshen up.
• Visit Manikaran Gurudwara (located at 5700 ft) and take a sacred bath in its hot springs.
• Enjoy a hot meal for lunch at the camp and rest for a few hours.
• Explore Kasol Market and cafes. Take a short hike to Chalal village via Parvati Valley, and click photos at Chalal Bridge.
• Visit a musical cafe as you reach Chalal village.
• Return to camp for an exquisite dinner and camp near the Parvati River under the stars.
• Night stay: Riverside Camping in Kasol or Cottages.
• Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner included.
• After breakfast, depart for Bhrigu Base Camp.
• Leave all your luggage in Manali and trek with a small backpack (water, snacks, raincoat, warm clothing).
• Begin the Bhrigu Lake trek and stay at the Bhrigu Lake Base Camp at around 10,000 ft with mesmerizing views.
• Enjoy the endless meadows on the trek.
• Night stay: Tent stay at Bhrigu Campsite.
• Meals: Breakfast, pack lunch, Dinner included.
• Begin the day with a hike to the first ridge, which is an hour away.
• In April, May, and June, the trail is usually covered in snow.
• In July, as the snow melts, the trail turns from green to brown and white.
• Trek to 14,300 ft height to witness a splendid view of Bhrigu Lake.
• This day ends with a summit party.
• Night stay: Tent stay at Bhrigu Campsite.
• Meals: Breakfast, pack lunch, Dinner included.
• Early morning trek down from the advance base camp.
• Visit Solang Valley and Atal Tunnel (Asia's longest tunnel).
• Explore Mall Road and Hadimba Temple.
• Dinner and night stay at a cottage/tent in Kullu.
• Meals: Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner included.
• Have breakfast and go for outdoor rope adventure activities.
• After camp activities, head to the highest paragliding spot in Manali (self-paid).
• Experience a bird's-eye view of Kullu Valley.
• Enjoy an 8 km white-water rafting adventure (Complimentary, no refund if not done).
• Visit the Kullu shawl factory.
• In the evening, start the drive to Una/Jalandhar.
• Meals: Breakfast, Lunch included.
• Return train journey begins.
• Enjoy the last moments with group games and friendly connections.
• Reach your city the next day according to your train time.
• Please note: You may reach the railway station 3-4 hours before departure time.
• Arrival at Ahmedabad Junction (Time: 01:45 PM) or your city according to the train timing.
• The trip concludes with beautiful memories. Au revoir!

inclusions: • Round trip sleeper class train tickets (subject to availability)
• 1 night stay at Kasol, 1 night stay at Kullu Campsite, 2 night stay at Manali
• 5 Breakfasts, 5 Lunches & 5 Dinners (1 Dinner at Golden Temple which is at no cost)
• Rope Adventure activities at Kullu Campsite
exclusions: • Personal Expenses
• Any cost arising due to natural calamities like landslides, road blocks etc. to be borne by the client directly on the spot
• Paragliding, Heater Charges, Tips, Pony Rides, Entry fee, Snow suit rents, Trekking stick, Adventure activities at Solang Valley, 4*4 Vehicle
• Personal Expenses of any kind, anything not specifically mentioned under the head 'Includes'
• Any additional meals or stays other than mentioned in the itinerary
• Guide during train journey
• Inter-railway station transfers are not included
highlights: • Visit Atal Tunnel (the world's longest tunnel above 10,000 ft)
• Visit the holy Golden Temple & Wagah Border in Amritsar
• Experience the Beauty of Parvati Valley
• 09 KM Long river Rafting (Included) & Paragliding from the Highest point in Kullu with a certified company
activities: • Snow Trekking
• Zipline
• Night Trek
• Team Games
• Campfire
• Sightseeing
• Rafting
• Paragliding
thingsToCarry: • Small backpack (to carry water bottle & personal stuff / 20-30 ltr)
• Lunchbox to Carry Packed Lunch on Trek
• Pair of light clothes, as per requirement
• Hat/Cap to cover your head in direct sunlight
• Camera, Power Bank, Charger, Earphones, Bluetooth speaker (depending on personal need)

title: Kedarnath Badrinath Tungnath Rishikesh
desc: The combined journey of Kedarnath, Tungnath, and Badrinath offers a blend of spirituality and adventure in the Himalayas.

description: • Start your train journey according to the scheduled train timings from your city to Delhi.
• Enjoy a comfortable journey through picturesque landscapes as you head towards Delhi, the gateway to our adventure.
• Only people aged 12 to 45 years are allowed to join this trip as it is a complete trekking & backpacking itinerary.
• Arrival at Delhi from your city.
• Explore Delhi on your own (We will suggest daytime budget stays and freshen-up places in Delhi).
• Meeting at the pickup location at 11:00 pm.
• Overnight journey by Tempo Traveller/bus.
• Pick up: Kashmiri Gate (Swaminarayan Mandir - Civil Lines metro).
• Departure time: 11:00 pm, Distance: 230 km | 6 hours.
• Night drive to Rishikesh.
• Arrive at Haridwar and visit the morning Aarti; later head to Rishikesh.
• Take a dip in the Ganga river and freshen up at the Ghat.
• Morning Ganga Aarti at Har Ki Pauri Ghat.
• Breakfast at Haridwar or Rishikesh as per time.
• Explore Rishikesh with options such as River Rafting & Cliff Jumping, Bungee jumping, Flying Fox, and Café hopping near river ghats.
• Ganga Aarti at Shatrughan Ghat or Triveni Ghat.
• Stay: Hotel/Tent in Rishikesh.
• Breakfast and Dinner Included.
• Early breakfast and leave for Phata/Sitapur.
• Visit Devprayag, Rudraprayag, and Dharidevi temple.
• Reach Phata late evening, have dinner, and rest.
• Distance: 210 km || 7-8 Hrs.
• Stay: Phata/Guptkashi.
• Breakfast and Dinner Included.
• Start early in the morning, leave extra luggage at the hotel.
• Sonprayag to Gaurikund by local jeep.
• Start the 21 km trek towards Kedarnath Dham (8-10 hours).
• Enjoy scenic beauty throughout the trek.
• Reach Kedarnath Temple, check in to the hotel room near the temple.
• Evening Aarti darshan at Kedarnath Temple.
• Stay: Kedarnath.
• Breakfast and Dinner Included.
• Early morning darshan and aarti.
• Explore surrounding areas like Bhimshila, Adi Shankaracharya Statue, Bhairav Temple.
• Trek down towards Gaurikund (4-6 hours).
• Reach Sitapur/Sonprayag by evening and travel back to Guptkashi.
• Stay: Phata/Guptkashi.
• Breakfast and Dinner Included.
• Breakfast and drive towards Chopta.
• Trek towards the world's highest Shiva temple at Tungnath (4-5 hours).
• Enjoy majestic views of the Himalayas, including Chaukhamba and Kedarnath peaks.
• Return to the campsite for dinner and rest.
• Stay: Chopta.
• Breakfast and Dinner Included.
• Early morning drive towards Badrinath (6-7 hours).
• Visit Mana Village, Saraswati River, and Bhim Pul.
• Evening darshan at Badrinath Temple.
• Stay: Badrinath/Pandukeshwar.
• Breakfast and Dinner Included.
• Early breakfast and departure towards Delhi.
• En route, visit Nand Prayag and Karna Prayag.
• Scenic drive through the Garhwal Himalayas.
• Reach Rishikesh in the evening and relax before the onward journey to Delhi.
• Overnight journey to Delhi.
• Breakfast Included.
• Early morning arrival in Delhi (around 5:00-6:00 AM).
• Drop-off at the designated location (Kashmiri Gate).
• The trip concludes with unforgettable memories of Kedarnath, Tungnath, Badrinath & the Himalayas.
• Travelers proceed with their return journey via train/flight as per their schedule.
• Arrival in your city as per your train schedule.

inclusions: • All transfers by Tempo Traveller/bus from Delhi.
• 6-night accommodation on sharing basis as per the itinerary.
• All sightseeing mentioned in the itinerary.
exclusions: • Personal expenses.
• Any cost arising due to natural calamities like landslides, roadblocks, etc., to be borne by the client directly on the spot.
• Personal expenses of any kind, anything not specifically mentioned under 'Includes'.
• Any additional meals or stays other than those mentioned in the itinerary.
• Inter-railway station transfers are not included.
• Any local transportation not mentioned (e.g., Sonprayag to Gaurikund jeep - 70 INR, local airport or railway station pick-up and drop).
highlights: • Dharidevi Temple - A beautiful temple of Goddess Kali in the middle of the river.
• Vishwanath Temple - Ancient Shiva temple in Guptkashi.
• Gaurikund - Hot water spring beside Mandakini river.
• Tapt Kund - Hot water spring besides Alaknanda river.
• Mana Village - Saraswati River, Vyas Gufa, Bheem Pul.
• Rishikesh - Ram Jhula to Laxman Jhula.
thingsToCarry: • Small backpack (to carry water bottle & personal stuff / 20-30 ltr).
• Pair of light clothes, as per requirement.
• Hat/Cap to cover your head in direct sunlight.
• Skin moisturizer, lip balm, sunscreen, etc.

• Polythene bags to store wet clothes/personal waste.

title: Mathura Agra Ayodhya Varanasi
desc: These form a significant spiritual and cultural hub in northern India, offering a rich tapestry of history, religion, and art..

description: • Morning 10 AM approx pick up and start your journey from Delhi/Mathura to Mathura, which is approximately a 3-hour drive.
• Upon arrival in Mathura, check-in at your hotel and freshen up.
• Visit Banke Bihari Temple.
• In the evening, witness the light & sound show at Prem Mandir.
• Overnight stay at Mathura/Agra.
• Dinner.
• After breakfast, checkout and visit Shri Krishna Janmabhoomi & Shri Dwarkadish Temple.
• Depart for Agra, a journey of around 2 hours.
• Visit Taj Mahal, the symbol of love, with detailed exploration of the stunning Mughal architecture and gardens.
• Afternoon, depart for Lucknow, a journey of around 4 hours.
• Overnight stay in Lucknow.
• Dinner.
• After breakfast, checkout and visit Saryu Nadi and Ram Janmabhoomi.
• Explore other places of interest like Hanuman Garhi and Kanak Bhawan.
• Later leave for Varanasi, a drive of approximately 5 hours.
• Check-in at your hotel in Varanasi.
• Overnight stay in Varanasi.
• Dinner.
• After breakfast, take a drive through BHU, Sankat Mochan Hanuman Mandir, and Durga Kund Temple.
• Take a boat ride along the Ganges River from Assi Ghat to Dashashwamedh Ghat.
• Visit the Kashi Vishwanath Temple, one of the holiest temples dedicated to Lord Shiva.
• In the evening, experience the mesmerizing Ganga Aarti at the famous Dashashwamedh Ghat.
• Later, explore the bustling markets and enjoy the local cuisine.
• Overnight stay at Varanasi.
• Dinner.
• After breakfast, checkout and visit Sarnath, where Lord Buddha gave his first sermon, and the Sarnath Archaeological Museum.
• Drive to Prayagraj, which takes about 2-3 hours.
• Explore the historic Anand Bhawan.
• If time permits, visit the Khusro Bagh and Patalpuri Temple.
• Visit the Triveni Sangam, the confluence of the Ganges, Yamuna, and mythical Saraswati rivers.
• 10:00 PM: Overnight journey to Delhi.
• Dinner.
• Morning, reach Delhi.
• Drop at Station.
• Trip ends with wonderful memories of the trip.

highlights: • Light & Sound Show at Prem Mandir
• Shri Krishna Janmabhoomi & Shri Dwarkadish Temple
• Ram Janmabhoomi and Saryu Nadi in Ayodhya
activities: • Visit and darshan at Banke Bihari Temple.
• Witness the light & sound show at Prem Mandir.
• Explore the Taj Mahal, including its history, gardens, and architectural features.
• Explore Shri Krishna Janmabhoomi & Shri Dwarkadish Temple in Mathura.
• Take a boat ride on the Ganges River from Assi Ghat to Dashashwamedh Ghat in Varanasi.
• Visit Sarnath and the Archaeological Museum.
• Attend the Ganga Aarti at Dashashwamedh Ghat in Varanasi.
• Visit the historic Anand Bhawan and Triveni Sangam in Prayagraj.
• Explore the Agra Fort and Mehtab Bagh for views of the Taj Mahal.

• In the evening, proceed to Jaisalmer (Overnight Journey).
• Reach Jaisalmer and transfer to hotel (for freshen up).

• Check-in to camp.
• Enjoy Jeep Safari & Camel safari.

• Explore the historical Jaigarh Fort and Amer Fort with stunning views of the Pink City.
• Visit the serene Jal Mahal, a palace on the water in the middle of the Man Sagar Lake.
• Visit Albert Hall Museum, Hawa Mahal, and Jantar Mantar in Jaipur, showcasing Mughal and Rajput architecture.
• Discover the haunted Kuldhara Village and explore Khaba Fort.
• Camel safari and Jeep safari in the desert near Sam Dunes, Jaisalmer.
• Visit the historic Jaisalmer Fort and Patwa ki Haveli.
• Explore the beautiful Saheliyon ki Bari and Fateh Sagar Lake in Udaipur.
• Visit the famous Dilwara Jain Temple and Nakki Lake in Mount Abu.

• Enjoy a panoramic view of Jaisalmer from the Jaisalmer Fort and visit historical havelis.

title: Saurashtra Darshan
desc: It's known for its blend of bustling cities and peaceful villages, including sacred temples, architectural sites, and beautiful beaches.

description: • Proceed to the sacred town of Dwarka.
• Visit Dwarkadeesh Temple.
• Take a holy dip in Gomti river.
• Overnight stay at the hotel.
• Leave in the morning for Nageshwar Jyotirling.
• Visit Gopi Talav and Bet Dwarka.
• On return, visit Rukmani Temple.
• Visit coastal temples.
• Attend evening Aarti at Dwarkadeesh Temple.
• Overnight stay at the hotel.
• Depart to Porbandar in the morning (75 km/1.5 hrs).
• Visit Kirti Mandir (birthplace of Mahatma Gandhi).
• Visit Sudama Temple (only one in the world).
• Proceed to Somnath (130 km/2.5 hrs).
• Visit Bhalka Tirth, Triveni Sangam, Geeta Mandir, Chopati, and Somnath Temple.

• Proceed to beach town Diu after breakfast (100 km/2 hrs).
• Visit St. Paul's Church, Diu Museum, and Diu Fort.
• Evening at leisure to relax on the beach.
• Overnight stay at the hotel.

• Visit Gir Interpretation Zone at Devaliya (Closed on Wednesday).

• Overnight stay at the hotel.
• Check out from hotel after breakfast.
• Visit Adalaj Stepwell and Akshardham Temple (Closed on Monday).
• Visit Gandhi Ashram.
• Drop at Railway Station or Airport.

title: Andaman & Nicobar Islands
desc: The islands also boast a rich cultural heritage, with indigenous tribes and festivals celebrating diverse traditions.

description: • Arrival at Port Blair by flight.
• Meet and greet by our representative at the airport, and transfer to hotel.
• Rest and relax in the hotel.
• In the evening, attend the enthralling Sound and Light Show at Cellular Jail, where the heroic saga of India's freedom struggle is brought alive.
• Post-show, return to hotel.
• Depart from Port Blair to Havelock Island by ferry, one of the most beautiful destinations in India.
• Arrive in Havelock and check-in at the resort.
• After some rest, head to the famous Radhanagar Beach - one of Asia's best beaches.
• Explore the white sand beach and enjoy the natural beauty.
• Return to the resort for relaxation.
• Day at leisure to relax on the beachside.
• Optional activities: Scuba Diving, Sea Walk, or simply enjoy the serene beach atmosphere.
• Check out from the hotel and board a cruise to Neil Island.
• Arrive at Neil Island and check-in at your resort.
• After rest, visit Bharatpur Beach and Laxmanpur Beach, a secluded beach with stunning coral views.
• Witness the mesmerizing sunset at Laxmanpur Beach.
• Return by ferry to Port Blair in the morning.
• Upon arrival, check-in at the hotel.
• Evening shopping tour to buy local souvenirs and gifts for friends and family.
• Begin a city tour of Port Blair.
• Visit Chatham Saw Mill, one of the oldest sawmills in Asia.
• Explore the Anthropological Museum to learn about the indigenous tribes of the Andaman and Nicobar Islands.
• Visit the Fisheries Museum, which showcases the rich marine biodiversity of the region.
• End the tour with a visit to Cellular Jail, one of the most historical monuments of India, which once housed famous political prisoners like Veer Savarkar.
• After breakfast, transfer to the airport for your departure.
• Return home with sweet memories of the Andaman Islands.

title: Spiti Valley
address: Spiti Valley Marango Rangarik, Himachal Pradesh
desc: a high-altitude cold desert mountain valley located in the northeastern part of Himachal Pradesh, known for its unique landscapes, ancient monasteries, and Tibetan-influenced culture.

description: • Boarding Point: Sabarmati BG Railway Station
• Reporting Time: 09:00 AM
• Kickstart your adventure with an overnight train journey from Ahmedabad to Chandigarh, passing through Gujarat, Rajasthan, and Haryana.
• Enjoy scenic views, bond with fellow travelers through fun activities, and soak in the local flavors at stops like Abu Road and Jaipur.
• Please note that if you have a connecting train from any station in Ahmedabad or Gandhinagar to Surat, Baroda, Mumbai, or Pune inter-station transfers are not included in our package.
• Arrival in Chandigarh - 8:00 AM
• Reach Chandigarh Railway Station in the early morning.
• Depart for Shimla by Traveler/Taxi, enjoying the scenic drive.
• Explore Shimla's famous Mall Road and shop for souvenirs.
• Experience the lively nightlife at Shimla's cafés and markets.
• Stay: Hotel in Shimla
• Shimla to Chitkul - The Ultimate Road Trip
• Kickstart an adventurous morning road trip from Shimla.
• Drive through the stunning landscapes of Kinnaur Valley.
• Visit Chitkul, the last village on the old Hindustan-Tibet trade route.
• Stay: Cottage in Chitkul/Kalpa
• Food: Breakfast, Dinner Included
• Chitkul to Tabo - A Scenic Himalayan Drive
• Begin the journey from Chitkul, experiencing the serene village life.
• Drive along the India-Tibet border, passing through Khab, the confluence of the Spiti & Sutlej Rivers.
• Stop by the beautiful Nako Lake for a peaceful retreat.
• Stay: Homestay in Tabo
• Food: Breakfast, Dinner Included
• Tabo to Kaza - Exploring Ancient Monasteries & Scenic Villages
• Visit the 1000-year-old Tabo Monastery, known for its ancient wall paintings and mud statues.
• Witness a breathtaking 360° sky view from Tabo.
• Explore Dhankar Village & Gompa, perched on a cliff with stunning valley views.
• Travel to Kaza, the headquarters of Spiti Valley.
• Stroll through Kaza Market, soaking in the local vibes.
• Stay: Homestay in Kaza
• Food: Breakfast, Dinner Included
• Exploring the Wonders of Spiti Valley
• Visit Key Monastery, the largest Tibetan Buddhist monastery in Spiti, known for its murals, manuscripts, and spiritual aura.
• Explore Komic, the world's highest motorable village (15,050 ft), and its ancient Komic Gompa.
• Witness the majestic Buddha Statue at Langza (14,300 ft) and discover fossils from an ancient seabed.
• Send a postcard from Hikkim, home to the world's highest post office (14,400 ft).
• Stay: Homestay in Kaza
• Food: Breakfast, Dinner Included
• Spiti Valley to Chandra Taal - A Journey to the Moon Lake
• Visit Kibber, a stunning high-altitude village known for its barren beauty and monasteries.
• Cross the Chicham Bridge, the highest bridge in Asia, offering breathtaking views.
• Travel to Chandra Taal, the mesmerizing 'Moon Lake' on the Samudra Tapu plateau.
• Overnight stay at Chandra Taal Camp.
• Note: Chandra Taal Lake usually opens by late May or June. If inaccessible, we stay in Kaza and reroute via Kalpa and Shimla.
• Stay: Swiss Tent in Chandratal
• Food: Breakfast, Dinner Included
• Chandra Taal to Manali - A Thrilling Journey
• Start the morning with a visit to the stunning Chandra Taal Lake.
• Travel to Manali via Chhatru, experiencing one of the world's most thrilling and scenic routes.
• Pass through the famous Atal Tunnel and explore the breathtaking Solang Valley.
• Stay: Homestay/Tent in Manali
• Food: Breakfast, Dinner Included
• Manali Adventure & Sightseeing
• Kickstart the day with thrilling adventure activities like paragliding and river rafting.
• Explore Manali's iconic spots, including Hadimba Devi Temple, Mall Road Market, and the charming Old Manali area.
• Food: Breakfast Included
• Departure from Manali & Return Journey
• Depart for Chandigarh early morning to catch the return train.
• Boarding Point: Chandigarh Station | Train Time: 05:55 PM.
• Enjoy the overnight journey back to Ahmedabad with new friends, memories, and thrilling experiences.
• Share your photos, videos, and stories, and engage in fun activities on the way home.
• Arrival in Ahmedabad - Journey Concludes
• Enjoy the famous Rabdi & Chaat as the train passes through Rajasthan in the morning.
• Arrive at Sabarmati BG, Ahmedabad at 03:10 PM.
• Time to bid farewell, cherish the memories, and conclude this incredible journey!
